title: Systematic Coronary Risk Evaluation 2-Older Persons (SCORE2-OP)
description: Predicts 5-year and 10-year cardiovascular disease (fatal and non-fatal myocardial infarction and stroke) risk in individuals aged 70 years and older without prior cardiovascular disease, accounting for competing risks.

parameters.name: risk_region
parameters.description: Cardiovascular risk region based on country

result.name: cvd_risk
result.description: Cardiovascular disease risk percentage at specified time horizon

ranges.interpretation: Generally no treatment benefit. Focus on lifestyle interventions. Consider individual patient characteristics and preferences in shared decision-making.
Treatment may be considered. Discuss benefits and risks with patient. Consider statin therapy and blood pressure management based on individual assessment and patient preferences.
Treatment generally recommended. Consider statin therapy and blood pressure management. Individualize treatment intensity based on life expectancy, frailty, and patient preferences.

references: SCORE2-OP working group and ESC Cardiovascular risk collaboration. SCORE2-OP risk prediction algorithms: estimating incident cardiovascular event risk in older persons in four geographical risk regions. Eur Heart J. 2021 Jul 1;42(25):2455-2467. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehab312.

de Vries TI, Cooney MT, Selmer RM, Hageman SHJ, Pennells L, Wood A, et al. SCORE2-OP risk prediction algorithms: estimating incident cardiovascular event risk in older persons in four geographical risk regions. Eur Heart J. 2021 Jul 1;42(25):2455-2467.

Visseren FLJ, Mach F, Smulders YM, Carballo D, Koskinas KC, Bäck M, et al. 2021 ESC Guidelines on cardiovascular disease prevention in clinical practice. Eur Heart J. 2021 Sep 7;42(34):3227-3337. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehab484.
formula: Competing risk-adjusted model accounting for non-CVD mortality, with age interactions and attenuation of risk factor gradients in older persons
notes: For individuals aged 70-89 years without previous cardiovascular disease
Accounts for competing risk of non-cardiovascular mortality
Risk factor gradients attenuate with age
Consider frailty, cognitive function, and patient preferences in treatment decisions
Treatment benefit-risk balance changes with age and life expectancy
